urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: The Met office have issued an amber warning for rain. We have issued flood alerts across the South West and are expecting to have to issue some flood warnings this afternoon. Please keep an eye on our flood warnings and know what to do in a flood https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15
Heavy rain across the South West is expected to impact some roads. Take care and never drive through flood water. https://t.co/XoURKx3zxw

We‚Äôre putting up flood barriers today in Frankwell (#Shrewsbury), #Hereford and #Bewdley. Are you #floodaware ? Sign up for alerts here 
https://t.co/hquuoBs8hF https://t.co/plRYE9aMbU

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK

tweets.text:
With heavy rain forecast into the weekend there's a risk of #flooding in parts of #Shropshire & #Herefordshire.

Our teams are getting prepared for #flood to keep communities safe. Are you prepared?

‚ö†Ô∏èPlease stay #FloodAware & check your flood risk here: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/9ls5vnQ8Mb

Heavy rain in the south-west of England today will bring a high risk of surface water #flooding.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.
For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority.

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ptfCwRMWSc

Out in #Warwick, #Leamington & #Rugby today with Rich & Adam clearing screens and checking hotspot areas ahead of the forecasted rain over the next few days. We‚Äôve also managed to do some #wildlife spotting at Mill Bridge in Leamington @EnvAgencyMids @Warwick_DC @rugbybc https://t.co/hnows0siUe

tweets.text: Second gauging of the day for @EnvAgencySW . River Fowey@ Restormel. Approx 39 cumecs. One of the Crown Jewels of Devon and Cornwall gauges- there is a major abstraction supplying most of Cornwall‚Äôs drinking water, plus it lies upstream of Lostwithiel, so is key for #floodwarning https://t.co/fAH8040xcQ

tweets.text:
@mrfly @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency @thameswater @LDNWaterkeeper If you scroll down on this link you'll see a long list of reasons as to why, in the EA's opinion, that section of the Lee is failing to make 'Good' overall environmental health. It makes for grim reading.

https://t.co/ErPUO30qmr

@UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @Feargal_Sharkey @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil The Deephams Sewage Treatment Works pours mind-boggling quantities of sewage into the Lee/Lea just upstream from here sadly. @EnvAgency waits for @thameswater to ask to be fined as they don't actively monitor. @LDNWaterkeeper is actively trying to combat this

The dramatic opening lines of the Press Conference given by Sir Edward Hardy, (formerly @KCCChair,) & spokesmen from the #Kent River Board, in the aftermath of the catastrophic 1953 North Sea flood:
https://t.co/0ZbvpsgI7k

https://t.co/XHwq0qmo30

#HBAHCommunication @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/8HWaLHK89D

tweets.text: This stretch of the river Lee through Tottenham Marshes is completely disgusting. Breaks my heart to see moorhens, ducks and coots scrambling over this filth. Who is responsible for cleaning it up? @CanalRiverTrust @Feargal_Sharkey @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil https://t.co/GU5NUR3Kqt

We prosecute waste criminals‚Ä¶ AND those who block efforts to do so‚Ä¶

Like a builder from #Essex, fined for hampering our probe into illegal dumping bales of waste in #Kent‚Ä¶

READ the whole story: https://t.co/7tdnjfgBcR

File pic: bales of waste left on private land https://t.co/2kQEkTATt2

@NWFishEA @FishFarmEA @EnvAgencyNW Thanks, is there grayling in the lune?
I caught a pike about 8lb just below Skelton weir about 20 years ago, I returned it, it might still be there.

Low tide, and the rivers in Truro are swollen. It‚Äôs usually just a trickle.

We‚Äôre prepared for a busy afternoon. Hear from the @EnvAgencySW @KWTWeather @CORMACltd on the phone-in @BBCCornwall. https://t.co/aza9zLINII

Allermoor Spillway stopped running early this morning, we had teams out first thing opening Monksleaze to operate the SOWY FRC at maximum capacity, this allows us to commence pumping at Langport stations until spillways start to run again. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/IhBXnHPOu1
@Feargal_Sharkey @SaveLeaMarshes @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency he means the river lea

@UnaPaloma @Feargal_Sharkey @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency Oh no! Please don't let them swim there. The authorities do not inform people about the extreme pollution here
River Lune today then south to the Lostock tomorrow üé£ @FishFarmEA @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/ZXQNo0n8Zg

@GarethTrewick @fishfacejohnny @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm If you are a landowner and the EA are doing fuck all to dredge the river etc what can he do? I have had lots of involvement with the EA- most are university graduates who have no common sense or experience- they sit behind a desk all day doing fuck all
@jarvisgarry @FishFarmEA @EnvAgencyNW Hi Garry, these are Roach, the bottom reach of the Lune has coarse fish and we are just giving them a boost
@Feargal_Sharkey @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency Oh god. And my dog regularly swims in this bit of the Leeü§Æ

Thanks to everyone that kept our capital projects going ... building the Masbrough fish pass and removing Slitting Mill Weir is not bad going! @steveholgate @FishtekConsult @CRTYorkshireNE @RMBCPress @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @WestonFdn @WeAreCallidus @ArcHeritageYAT https://t.co/y8oz5N3cDJ

A great example of the @EnvAgency 's collaborative delivery framework in action! I look forward to my visit in January to see its progress. https://t.co/tEYNLabYdJ
@matthewray21 @cllrjameshill @LockTask @pinder_chauhan @EnvAgency @SNorthantsC Can you advise where the rubbish is so that I can arrange for it to be removed? Thanks, EP

Fly-tipping is a criminal offence & we continue to take action. We recently issued a total of ¬£1,200 in fines for three fly-tips in #Charnwood. Two ¬£400 fines for fly-tips in #Shepshed & a ¬£400 fine for rubbished dumped in #Syston which could be traced back to where it came from. https://t.co/9bfz7FO816
